TopicTitle: OMSK Space Products - Stockalike Atlas rockets & more! [Omich-L Beta]

Articles.Content:
Hey SnowWhite! I love the work you are doing; it's great stuff. As for suggestions, I have a few. 

I've always wanted to see someone make the CARV, a variant of the ATV designed to survive reentry. It's slightly more conical in shape. IRL, it would just carry supplies, but I think it has huge potential as a manned spacecraft; I'd love to fly kerbals around in it! 

![xE6LHHN.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xE6LHHN.jpg)

For some more general ideas, take a look at this page:

[http://www.astronautix.com/fam/cev.htm](http://www.astronautix.com/fam/cev.htm)

A number of companies submitted proposals to NASA for the next manned spacecraft. In the end, NASA went with the somewhat boring Orion, but there are a lot of neat ideas out there.

> 
> It is conceived from the first, just like on the real space station where only few modules have hatch. Then use orbital ships with hatches to get outside.

i get that, but when you move a Kerbal to the Lab, then theres no way of transfering (click the hatch --> chose transfer --> click another part of the ship) him to another part of the vessel. IMHO this makes the part useless ...

> 
> Hey SnowWhite! I love the work you are doing; it's great stuff. As for suggestions, I have a few. 
> I've always wanted to see someone make the CARV, a variant of the ATV designed to survive reentry. It's slightly more conical in shape. IRL, it would just carry supplies, but I think it has huge potential as a manned spacecraft; I'd love to fly kerbals around in it!

> 
> For some more general ideas, take a look at this page:

> [http://www.astronautix.com/fam/cev.htm](http://www.astronautix.com/fam/cev.htm)
> 
> A number of companies submitted proposals to NASA for the next manned spacecraft. In the end, NASA went with the somewhat boring Orion, but there are a lot of neat ideas out there.

Very nice concepts give me a thoughts about manned spacecraft from "Omich" series. Thank you for this!

> 
> i get that, but when you move a Kerbal to the Lab, then theres no way of transfering (click the hatch --> chose transfer --> click another part of the ship) him to another part of the vessel. IMHO this makes the part useless ...

Khm... Yes, I had not thought about this. I'll add special hatches for equipage thansfer. Much thanks for bugreport.![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Next update will be a little bit uncommon. But at first, tell me, what would be better: to have super-duper realistic textures or BD-armory alike textures for turrets?

> ![g3kXvRX.png](http://i.imgur.com/g3kXvRX.png)

> 
> Hey SnowWhite! I love the work you are doing; it's great stuff. As for suggestions, I have a few. 
> I've always wanted to see someone make the CARV, a variant of the ATV designed to survive reentry. It's slightly more conical in shape. IRL, it would just carry supplies, but I think it has huge potential as a manned spacecraft; I'd love to fly kerbals around in it!

>

> A number of companies submitted proposals to NASA for the next manned spacecraft. In the end, NASA went with the somewhat boring Orion, but there are a lot of neat ideas out there.

That pod looks alot like ANGARA ![hbaDCvl.png](http://i.imgur.com/hbaDCvl.png)

> 
> That pod looks alot like ANGARA [http://i.imgur.com/hbaDCvl.png](http://i.imgur.com/hbaDCvl.png)

Yeah, it does seem like a lot of next gen. spacecraft are following the same basic design. 

What mod is that from, by the way? It is a beautiful pod!

Hey great design ! I like the small details Omich K, for the service module, why not add some pipes from the motors to the tanker ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
I mean well and everything but... what happened to the Titan II?

> 
> for the service module, why not add some pipes from the motors to the tanker ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Because Tiangong does not have pipes [IRL](http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/photo/2012-06/18/131660377_41n.jpg). The second reason is SM will be look like just as Soyuz engine from tantares.

> 
> I mean well and everything but... what happened to the Titan II?

It's alive!

Our new Grand Plan is:

1. Omich-K
2. Omich-O
3. Titan II
4. Delta 2
5. Delta 4
6. (Possibly) Saturn I and other stuff

Regarding to our new texturer, texture for Omich-K is ready! What do you think about this?

> ![WW0YmDi.png](http://i.imgur.com/WW0YmDi.png)

Antenna added to Omich-K SM.

> ![09ajHIa.png](http://i.imgur.com/09ajHIa.png)

The Grand Plan ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

I like the look of Omich K reminds me a canned food ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) And I love the itty bitty antenna, great work ! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-22T14:29:04Z" title="07/22/2015 02:29  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 22, 2015</time> by Herr Rictus Bingo**

Some feedback:

I just tried , atlas rocket and i couldn't reach orbite ( im in RSS) , i made some tests to balance it:

-atlas main engine: 100thrust - 370isp(asl)/320isp(Vac) 1.5t (switch emissive flame with atlas booster engine).

- atlas booster engine : 300thrust - 320isp(asl) - 370ips(vac) 1.5t (switch emissive flame with atlas main engine).

--> in reality: main engine 300kN + 2x(booster engine 650kN) , they got same size.

almost finished with example files, will upload soon

EDIT: couldnt get the craft files uploaded to kerbalx, but here they are

[http://www.curse.com/shareables/kerbal/233196-omsk-example-craft](http://www.curse.com/shareables/kerbal/233196-omsk-example-craft)

I didn't take any time making pictures, but i will post them

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-27T15:58:29Z" title="07/27/2015 03:58  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 27, 2015</time> by JPmAn**
Hi SnowWhite, I'm having issues with the Omnich download. I'm using 1.0.4. Is that an issue?
Here's an idea I had for the Omnich Crew transfer pod, It's based off of the Soviet L-1/Zond Vehicle. It is basically Soyuz with 2 seats, no orbital module and an extended SM.
Info here: [http://www.astronautix.com/craft/soyz7kl1.htm](http://www.astronautix.com/craft/soyz7kl1.htm)
How did you make the Titan? And is this only using OMSK or does it need other mods?
Used stock and OMSK, and I used cubic struts and the atlas outboard engines for the cluster

@[MajorLeaugeRocketScience](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/152567-MajorLeaugeRocketScience) 

I know very well about LOK and Zond, and all these thing are already exist in Tantares. About issue: I'll test Omich-L beta today in 1.0.4. Also, don't multipost, please- use **Edit** button to add some new things to your message.

@JPmAn

Thank you for your work, link added to OP.

About progress:

We are working hard on the Omich-k and another pretty big update.
What are the Omich labs based off of?

So you want something new and not in any mods? I can't wait to see what you come up with. Although I might suggest the Apollo Block III and AARDVark from eyes turned skywards: [http://wiki.alternatehistory.com/doku.php/timelines/eyes_turned_skyward_spacecraft_and_launch_vehicle_technical_data](http://wiki.alternatehistory.com/doku.php/timelines/eyes_turned_skyward_spacecraft_and_launch_vehicle_technical_data)

Is Omnich going to have a launcher? I don't want to ask you for anything but a Saturn Multibody would 

be amazing ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) (same link

Sorry for the trouble, it Omnich works fine I was looking in utilities instead of science with like 10 other mods installed
